text: Global Energy Monitor is a non-governmental organization which catalogs worldwide fossil fuel infrastructure, such as gas pipelines, in support of fossil fuel phase-out. Founded by Ted Nace in 2008, it maintains a database of worldwide coal-fired power stations in its "widely respected" Global Coal Plant Tracker and reports annually on trends, especially in India and China. ==See also== * 350.org * Climate Reality Project * European Renewable Energy Council * Greenpeace ==References== ==Further reading== * ==External links== * Coal Transitions Category:Fossil fuels
title: Global Energy Monitor
